translated: Having invited the pristine consciousness ma·πá·∏çala, having offered the preliminary water for the feet and the offerings, and so on, one should perform the burnt offering.

analyzed: gsum mam / bdun nam /

original: snying ga zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: snying ga zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /

original: de la de kho na nyid ni thar pa'i go 'phang gi mchog go //
analyzed: de la de kho na nyid ni thar pa'i go 'phang gi mchog go //
translated: There, reality is the supreme state of liberation.

analyzed: bden ba ni dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin no //

original: de la de kho na nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la de kho na nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is reality like there?

original: 'dod chags che las byung de nyid //
analyzed: 'dod chags che las byung de nyid //
translated: That reality arises from great passion.

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /

analyzed: bden pa ji lta bu zhe na /

analyzed: chos thams cad gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ba'i bdag nyid can gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi sku dang ldan pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo ni bden ba yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go // de la ; nam mkha' skye ba'i mtshan ldan phyir //

analyzed: de la tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis ni de kho na nyid gsum gyi glu ston to //

translated: Therein, the three realities are the reality of nature, the reality of endowment, and the reality of purification.üîΩWith reference to the reality of nature, a verse:

analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyi de kho na nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas tshigs su bcad pa ni nam mkha' skye ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /

original: de kho na nyid gtso bor gyur cing de kho na nyid du ro gcig pa spros pa med pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes byang chub kyi sems ni 'di'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: de kho na nyid gtso bor gyur cing de kho na nyid du ro gcig pa spros pa med pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes byang chub kyi sems ni 'di'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: The nature of this is the Thought of Enlightenment, the non-conceptual intuition, which is the one taste of reality, free from conceptual elaborations, and which is the principal reality.

analyzed: de nyid ni rdo rje chen po sti mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That itself is the great vajra, because it is indivisible.

original: des na sems dpa' rdo rje che rang bzhin //üîΩzhes bya'o // rdo rje sems dpa' bdag gru ba mdzod //
analyzed: des na sems dpa' rdo rje che rang bzhin // zhes bya'o // rdo rje sems dpa' bdag gru ba mdzod //
translated: Therefore, it is the nature of the great being-vajra.

original: ces bya ba ni rang bdag nyid du mdzod cig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rang bdag nyid du mdzod cig ces bya ba'o //
translated: The words be the vajra-being for me mean be my very self.

original: sems la ni skye ba yod pa yin la skye ba dang ldan pa ni 'jig par 'gyur ba yin mod kyi 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das gang yin pa de ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa yin la /
analyzed: sems la ni skye ba yod pa yin la skye ba dang ldan pa ni 'jig par 'gyur ba yin mod kyi 'on kyang bcom ldan 'das gang yin pa de ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa yin la /
translated: Although the mind does have arising, and what has arising will certainly perish, nevertheless, the Bhagavat is without beginning or end.

original: de ltar na 'di ni byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin yin no //
translated: Thus, this is the nature of the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi sems de yang gang yin zhe na gang 'di byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i sems kyi rgyun stong pa nyid du ro gcig pas nam mkha' dang 'dra bas rang bzhin gyis dag pa byang chub sems dpa' thams cad
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de yang gang yin zhe na gang 'di byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i sems kyi rgyun stong pa nyid du ro gcig pas nam mkha' dang 'dra bas rang bzhin gyis dag pa byang chub sems dpa' thams cad
translated: What is this enlightenment mind? It is the continuum of the bodhisattvas‚Äô minds, which is without beginning or end, and is of one taste in emptiness, like space, and so is naturally pure.

original: kyi thun mong du gyur pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi sku'i sa rnams la glo bur ba'i sgrib ba rim gyis rnam par dag pa'i mthar thug par rtogs par 'gyur ba yin bas de sku des byang chub kyi sems zhes bya bar bshad do //
analyzed: kyi thun mong du gyur pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi sku'i sa rnams la glo bur ba'i sgrib ba rim gyis rnam par dag pa'i mthar thug par rtogs par 'gyur ba yin bas de sku des byang chub kyi sems zhes bya bar bshad do //
translated: It is the suchness body common to all bodhisattvas, and it is realized to be the ultimate, the gradual purification of adventitious obscurations on the levels. Therefore it is explained as the enlightenment mind of that body.

original: des na byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin can gyis bcom ldan 'das de la thog ma dang tha ma ga la mnga'/
analyzed: des na byang chub kyi sems kyi rang bzhin can gyis bcom ldan 'das de la thog ma dang tha ma ga la mnga'/
translated: Therefore, how could the Bhagavat, who has the nature of the enlightenment mind, have a beginning or end?

original: gang yang 'di sgrib pa dang bral bar gyur na gsal bar 'gyur bas 'di'i skye bar nye bar gdags su rung ste /
analyzed: gang yang 'di sgrib pa dang bral bar gyur na gsal bar 'gyur bas 'di'i skye bar nye bar gdags su rung ste /
translated: And when it is free from obscurations, it becomes manifest, so it is suitable to impute its arising.

original: dper na nam mkha' rtsig pa la sogs pa gsal bar snang ba dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' rtsig pa la sogs pa gsal bar snang ba dang 'dra ba'o //

original: de'i phyir / nam mkha' skye ba'i mtshan ldan phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir / nam mkha' skye ba'i mtshan ldan phyir //
translated: Because space has the characteristic of arising,

analyzed: zhes smos pa'i dpe 'di la yod pas nam mkha' skye ba'i mtshan ldan te de'i ngo bo @103a * //

original: nyid ni de nyid de de'i phyir thog ma tha ma med pa'o //
analyzed: nyid ni de nyid de de'i phyir thog ma tha ma med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is without beginning or end.

original: mchog ni gtso bo'o //
analyzed: mchog ni gtso bo'o //
translated: Supreme means foremost.

original: 'byor pa'i de kho na nyid kyi dbang du byas pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni kun mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'byor pa'i de kho na nyid kyi dbang du byas pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni kun mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: A verse on the analysis of the reality of endowment:

original: dngos grub thams cad kyi mchog ni dngos grub chen po ste yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad kyi mchog ni dngos grub chen po ste yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
translated: The supreme of all powers is the supreme of all powers, which is perfect enlightenment.

original: des na dbang phyug chen po ste /
analyzed: des na dbang phyug chen po ste /
translated: Therefore, he is the great lord,

analyzed: stobs bcu mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la dbang ba'i mchog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: the supreme master of all dharmas such as the ten powers and the four confidences.

original: des na lhag pa'i lha yin te /
analyzed: des na lhag pa'i lha yin te /
translated: Therefore, he is the transcendent,

analyzed: 'jig rten pa thams cad las lhag pa'i lha nyid do //
translated: the transcendent one who is superior to all mundane beings.

original: thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje brnyes pas na rdo rje 'dzin pa kun te /

analyzed: 'dun dang spro dang gnas dang blo //

original: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
analyzed: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
translated: the limb of enlightenment of correct pliancy,üîΩthe limb of enlightenment of correct meditative stabilization,

original: ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag go //
translated: and the limb of enlightenment of correct sameness.

original: 'di'i yang mthong ba'i lam gyi chos rnam par 'byed pa ni lus yin la /
analyzed: 'di'i yang mthong ba'i lam gyi chos rnam par 'byed pa ni lus yin la /
translated: Here, the discrimination of phenomena is the body of the path of seeing.

original: lhag ma rnams ni 'khor yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni 'khor yin no //
translated: The remaining limbs are its retinue.

original: de yang chos rnams la dran pa nye bar 'jog pas chos rnam par 'byed pa ni bden pa mthong ba'i bdag nyid can thob pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang chos rnams la dran pa nye bar 'jog pas chos rnam par 'byed pa ni bden pa mthong ba'i bdag nyid can thob pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, since one establishes mindfulness in regard to the dharmas, the discernment of dharmas is the attainment of the nature of the vision of the truths.

original: de yang brtson 'grus kyis ni ma lus par thob la //
analyzed: de yang brtson 'grus kyis ni ma lus par thob la //
translated: And that is attained through vigor.

original: de skyes pas kyang dga' ba 'thob pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pas ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de skyes pas kyang dga' ba 'thob pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pas ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur la /
translated: And through the arising of that, one attains joy, and through serenity, one abides in samadhi, and one is not defiled.

original: des nyon mongs pa'i sa bon gyi bdag nyid can gyi gnas ngan len bsal bas de nyon mongs pa med pa ni btang snyoms zhes bya bar bshad de /
analyzed: des nyon mongs pa'i sa bon gyi bdag nyid can gyi gnas ngan len bsal bas de nyon mongs pa med pa ni btang snyoms zhes bya bar bshad de /
translated: And through that, one removes the negative reflex actions which have the nature of the seeds of the defilements, and one is without defilements. This is explained as equanimity.

original: de bas na byang chub kyi yan lag bdun du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub kyi yan lag bdun du 'gyur ba yin no //

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gru bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gru bzhi pa'o //
translated: The there is the square mandala.

original: 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor ro //

original: gang gis ni der dkyil 'khor brgyad pa lta bur byas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis ni der dkyil 'khor brgyad pa lta bur byas pa yin zhe na /

original: 'khor lo la sogs pa ka ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'khor lo la sogs pa ka ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The ‚Äúpillars‚Äù are the wheels, etc.

original: 'khor lo'i ka ba gnyis dang rin po che'i ka ba gnyis dang / padma'i ka ba gnyis dang / ral gri'i ka ba gnyis so //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i ka ba gnyis dang rin po che'i ka ba gnyis dang / padma'i ka ba gnyis dang / ral gri'i ka ba gnyis so //

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad de kho na nyid du sbyangs pas so //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad de kho na nyid du sbyangs pas so //
translated: They are the eight liberations, because they are purified in reality.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight liberations?

original: gzugs can gzugs @115b rnams la blta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
analyzed: gzugs can gzugs @115b rnams la blta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //

analyzed: nang gzugs med par gyur pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o //

analyzed: sdug pa'i rnam par lta ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa gsum po'o //

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa dang / yod min med min gyi skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa dang /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa dang / yod min med min gyi skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa dang /

analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i rnam par thar pa'o //

analyzed: de la gzugs can zhes bya ba ni mthong ba po'i bdag nyid ni gzugs can zhes bya'o //

original: gzugs zhes bya ba ni blta bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba ni blta bar bya ba ste /

original: gzugs chung du'am chen po 'am kha dog ngan pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs chung du'am chen po 'am kha dog ngan pa'am /
translated: One sees form as small or large, bad or good,üîΩas one wishes, of gods or humans.

original: bzang po'am / lha dang mi'i ci 'dod par mthong ba zhes bya ba lhag par mos pa'i mthong pas sprul pa'i sgrib pa med pa nas mos pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: bzang po'am / lha dang mi'i ci 'dod par mthong ba zhes bya ba lhag par mos pa'i mthong pas sprul pa'i sgrib pa med pa nas mos pa'i bar du'o //

analyzed: nang gi gzugs su 'du shes pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ba po bdag nyid la gzugs can du 'du shes 'jog pa'o /

original: lhag ma ni snga ma dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma dang 'dra ba'o //

original: de yang ji lta ba bzhin du sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i gzugs kyi mtshan ma sprul pa rnams la de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i sgo nas sdug par ro gcig par lhag par mos nas bsgom zhing snyoms par 'jug ste /

original: / de thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das pas nam mkha'i 'du shes thams cad du nye bar 'phel bas nam mkhar lhag par mos nas sgom zhing snyoms par 'jug pa de ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched do //

original: de la dbang thob par gyur pa nyid ni rnam par thar pa ste /
analyzed: de la dbang thob par gyur pa nyid ni rnam par thar pa ste /

original: de'i sgrib pa rnams las rnam par thar pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sgrib pa rnams las rnam par thar pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: rnam par thar pa 'og ma'i don rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //üîΩde nas nam mkha'i 'du shes las kyang yang dag par 'das nas rnam par shes pa gang gis sngar nam mkhar mos par byed pa'i @116a * //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa 'og ma'i don rnams la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro // de nas nam mkha'i 'du shes las kyang yang dag par 'das nas rnam par shes pa gang gis sngar nam mkhar mos par byed pa'i @116a * //
translated: The meaning of the other liberations should be applied in the same way.üîΩThen, having transcended the discernment of space,üîΩone cultivates and enters meditative attainment, aspiring to the infinite consciousness that previously aspired to space.

original: rnam par shes pa de nyid mtha' yas par lhag par mos shing rnam par shes pa ni mtha' yas so zhes bsgom zhing snyoms par 'jug pa de ni rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched do //

original: de rnam par shes pa las gzhan du dmigs pa tshol ba ni gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa ci yang ma rnyed pa na de ci yang med do zhes ci yang med par lhag par mos zhing sgom pa la snyoms par 'jug pa de yang ci
analyzed: de rnam par shes pa las gzhan du dmigs pa tshol ba ni gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa ci yang ma rnyed pa na de ci yang med do zhes ci yang med par lhag par mos zhing sgom pa la snyoms par 'jug pa de yang ci
translated: When one searches for something other than consciousness, if one does not find anything at all, whether it is physical or not physical, then one cultivates and enters meditative attainment, aspiring to the base of nothingness.

original: yang med pa'i skye mched do //
analyzed: yang med pa'i skye mched do //

original: de rgya che ba la sogs pa nyid kyis nyes pa mthong nas ci yang med pa'i 'du shes las ldog ste /üîΩde cung zad med pa'i 'du shes las ni snga ma nyid du log pa yin la /

analyzed: da ltar ni ci yang med pa'i 'du shes las kyang log pa yin no //

analyzed: de bas na 'di la 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ces bya'o //

analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched de nyid la brten nas nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pas bsdus pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams 'gog pa de ni 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'o //
translated: The cessation of perception and feeling is the cessation of mind and mental activities included in the realm of desire and the realm of form, and also the cessation of the defiled mind and the defiled part of the store consciousness.

original: 'dir rnam par thar pa gnyis ni ci 'dod par sprul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir rnam par thar pa gnyis ni ci 'dod par sprul pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rnam par thar pa gsum pa ni sprul pas kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //

original: lhag ma bzhi po ni zhi bar gnas pa la dbang du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma bzhi po ni zhi bar gnas pa la dbang du gyur pa'o //

analyzed: gcig ni mchog tu zhi bar gnas pa la dbang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: brgyad po 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i rnam par thar pa ste /
analyzed: brgyad po 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i rnam par thar pa ste /

original: 'dis 'phags pa rnams gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis 'phags pa rnams gnas pa'i phyir ro //

original: de bas na gnas pa'i bde bas sten par byed pas ka ba ni rnam par thar pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gnas pa'i bde bas sten par byed pas ka ba ni rnam par thar pa yin no //

analyzed: de kho na nyid 'di dag ni dpal mchog dang po las blangs pa yin la /

translated: The remaining realities are taken from the Sri-Vajra≈õekhara and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes rnams kyis sems can gyi shes pa rnams chags shing sgyur bar mdzad pas na tshon no //

analyzed: bsngags shing shis pa'i yid tshim pa ni yid rab tu tshim pa'o //

analyzed: chos kyi zas ni chos kyi ro la dga' ba'o //

analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i bde ba chen po rnam par 'phel ba de ni glu la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid yin no //

translated: The reality of the ma·πá·∏çala is the essence gathered,

analyzed: de len cing 'dzin par byed pas ni dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: It is a ma·πá·∏çala because it takes up and holds that.

translated: After the statement of the reality of the ma·πá·∏çala, the reality of the deity should be explained, so it is said ‚Äúthe reality of the wheel, etc.‚Äù

translated: Moreover, enlightenment is the reality of the ma·πá·∏çala of the support, completely pure in every way.

original: byang chub de la sems gang rnam @117a * //
analyzed: byang chub de la sems gang rnam @117a * //
translated: The mind that is directed toward that enlightenmentüîΩ

original: pa thams cad du yongs su dag pa de ni rten pa po'i dkyil 'khor yin no //
analyzed: pa thams cad du yongs su dag pa de ni rten pa po'i dkyil 'khor yin no //
translated: That mind which is completely pure in every way with regard to that enlightenment is the mandala of the supporter.

original: sku sogs 'dzin pa'i rnal 'byor sems //üîΩzhes bya ba ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi gsang ba rnams la rnal 'byor te /
analyzed: sku sogs 'dzin pa'i rnal 'byor sems // zhes bya ba ni sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi gsang ba rnams la rnal 'byor te /
translated: The mind of the yogi who holds the body, etc.üîΩis the mandala of the supported.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'dus pa'i sems gang yin pa de'i bdag nyid du mthong ba'i rnal 'byor pa'i sems de nyid ni yang dag par na rten pa po'i dkyil 'khor yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'dus pa'i sems gang yin pa de'i bdag nyid du mthong ba'i rnal 'byor pa'i sems de nyid ni yang dag par na rten pa po'i dkyil 'khor yin no //
translated: The mind of the yogi who sees that very mind of his as being of the nature of the mind of the assembly of the Buddhas is the mandala of the supported in reality.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir sems nyid ni dad pa la sogs pa dbang po bzhi rnam par dag pas sgo srung bzhi'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems nyid ni dad pa la sogs pa dbang po bzhi rnam par dag pas sgo srung bzhi'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: Because the mind itself is the nature of the four gate-guardians, being purified as the four faculties of faith, etc.

original: de yang shes rab kyi dbang po rnam par dag pas shin tu dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: de yang shes rab kyi dbang po rnam par dag pas shin tu dri ma med pa'o //
translated: And that is completely stainless, being purified as the faculty of wisdom.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi phyi rol dag cing dri ma med pa de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi phyi rol dag cing dri ma med pa de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: The external purity and stainlessness of the six perfections such as giving, which is their identity, is the nature of Vajra Body, etc.

original: gang gi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug po ni de rnams kyi de kho na nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug po ni de rnams kyi de kho na nyid yin no //
translated: Because the six perfections are their reality.

original: sa ni sa'i khams so //
analyzed: sa ni sa'i khams so //
translated: Earth is the earth element.

original: thabs ni thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: thabs ni thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Skill is the perfection of skill.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni chu dang me dang rlung gi khams dang / smon lam dang / stobs dang ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni chu dang me dang rlung gi khams dang / smon lam dang / stobs dang ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams bsdu'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúetc.‚Äù include the water, fire, and wind elements, and the perfections of aspiration, strength, and pristine awareness.

original: mtshan ma med pa ni dga' ba bzhi po'o //üîΩ'di rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni de kho na ste sems yin la /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni dga' ba bzhi po'o // 'di rnams kyi ngo bo nyid ni de kho na ste sems yin la /
translated: Signlessness is the four joys.üîΩTheir reality is just that, i.e., mind.

original: de ni de'i rang bzhin can yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni de'i rang bzhin can yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that he has that as his nature.

original: de yang gang gi phyir de rnams lha mo bzhi'i rang bzhin yin ba de'i phyir de nyid de kho na nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang gang gi phyir de rnams lha mo bzhi'i rang bzhin yin ba de'i phyir de nyid de kho na nyid yin no //
translated: Moreover, because they have the nature of the four goddesses, they are reality.

original: sa la sogs pa ji ltar na de kho na nyid yin zhes rtog na //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa ji ltar na de kho na nyid yin zhes rtog na //
translated: How can earth, etc. be reality?

original: de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis so zhes kho bo smra ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis so zhes kho bo smra ste /
translated: We say that they are reality by their suchness nature.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus yang dag par bsdus pa'i phyir dang nang gi sa la sogs pa gang gi yin pa de rnams kyang de kho nyid yin te /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skus yang dag par bsdus pa'i phyir dang nang gi sa la sogs pa gang gi yin pa de rnams kyang de kho nyid yin te /
translated: Because they are included in the Complete Enjoyment Body, and because they are the inner earth, etc. they are reality.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault, because they are the nature of extremely pure intuition.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What are the perfections of giving, etc.?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa byang chub kyi sems la brten te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa byang chub kyi sems la brten te /
translated: The bodhisattva, abiding in the reality of the bodhisattva, relying on the thought of awakening,

original: snying rje sngon du 'gro ba'i sems kyis bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnams dang / de bzhin du sngom pa thams @117b cad yang dag par blangs te srung ba dang / de bzhin du gnod pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad la bzod par gnas pa dang /
analyzed: snying rje sngon du 'gro ba'i sems kyis bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnams dang / de bzhin du sngom pa thams @117b cad yang dag par blangs te srung ba dang / de bzhin du gnod pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad la bzod par gnas pa dang /
translated: The actions of body, speech and mind that completely give away all one's possessions with a mind preceded by compassion,üîΩsimilarly, the protection of all vows that one has taken, similarly, the patience of remaining in the face of all the suffering of harm,

original: de bzhin du dge ba'i chos thams cad yang dag par bsdu ba la spro ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnams te de dag ni go rims bzhin du sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba'i chos thams cad yang dag par bsdu ba la spro ba'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnams te de dag ni go rims bzhin du sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
translated: and similarly, the enthusiasm for gathering all virtuous dharmas, are the perfections of generosity, morality, patience, and effort, respectively.

original: de bzhin du lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnams la rnam pa thams cad du dbang du gyur pas sems rnam pa thams cad du yang dag par gnas pa dang gang de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad du chos rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnams la rnam pa thams cad du dbang du gyur pas sems rnam pa thams cad du yang dag par gnas pa dang gang de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad du chos rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: Likewise, since they have complete mastery over their physical, verbal and mental actions, their minds are completely focused and they completely discern phenomena.

original: de dag ni bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, the perfection of meditation is the complete stability of mind in all its aspects, due to complete mastery of all actions of body, speech, and mind. The perfection of wisdom is the complete discernment of all aspects of things.

original: 'dir yang chos nyid ni rigs so //
analyzed: 'dir yang chos nyid ni rigs so //
translated: Here, the reality is the spiritual gene.

original: byang chub kyi sems ni smon pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni smon pa'o //
translated: The thought of enlightenment is the aspiration.

original: bdog pa ni gang ci yod pa'o //
analyzed: bdog pa ni gang ci yod pa'o //
translated: Possessions are whatever one has.

original: sdom pa ni mi dge ba las ldog pa'o //
analyzed: sdom pa ni mi dge ba las ldog pa'o //
translated: Vows are the turning away from evil.

original: gnod pa thams cad bzod pa ni bsten nus pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pa thams cad bzod pa ni bsten nus pa'o //
translated: Patience is the ability to endure all injuries.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad la btang snyoms su 'jog pa ni gnod pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad la btang snyoms su 'jog pa ni gnod pa'o //
translated: Equanimity is the indifference to all suffering.

original: dbang thob pa ni bdag por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dbang thob pa ni bdag por gyur pa'o //
translated: Mastery is the state of being a master.

original: gnas pa ni mnyam par 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni mnyam par 'jog pa'o //
translated: Stability is meditative equipoise.

original: rnam par 'byed pa ni nges par dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa ni nges par dpyod pa'o //
translated: Discernment is thorough analysis.

original: thabs la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: thabs la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What are the perfections of means, strength, and knowledge?

original: gang pha rol tu phyin pa de rnams nyid byang chub chen por yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang de rnams nyid skye ba thams cad du yang dag par spyad par bya ba'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa khyad par can du smon cing don du gnyer ba dang /
analyzed: gang pha rol tu phyin pa de rnams nyid byang chub chen por yongs su bsngo ba dang / gang de rnams nyid skye ba thams cad du yang dag par spyad par bya ba'i phyir skye ba la sogs pa khyad par can du smon cing don du gnyer ba dang /
translated: The perfection of skill in regard to expedients is the special aspiration and pursuit of birth, etc., in order to practice those perfections in all births.üîΩThe perfection of strength is the power of wisdom that arises from effort in order to practice those perfections continuously in all births, and the power of meditation that arises from previous practice.

original: gang de rnams nyid skye ba thams cad du rgyun du bya ba'i phyir 'bad pa las byung ba'i nus pa'i shes rab kyi stobs zhes bya ba dang / sngon goms pa las byung ba'i bsgom pa'i stobs zhes bya ba dag dang / gang de rnams nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pa chen pos dgongs pa can gyi don thams cad yang dag par shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang de rnams nyid skye ba thams cad du rgyun du bya ba'i phyir 'bad pa las byung ba'i nus pa'i shes rab kyi stobs zhes bya ba dang / sngon goms pa las byung ba'i bsgom pa'i stobs zhes bya ba dag dang / gang de rnams nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'bad pa chen pos dgongs pa can gyi don thams cad yang dag par shes pa'o //
translated: The perfection of vows is the knowledge of all the intended meanings of those perfections through great effort in order to teach them.

original: de dag ni go rims ji lta ba bzhin du thabs dang smon lam dang stobs dang ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni go rims ji lta ba bzhin du thabs dang smon lam dang stobs dang ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
translated: These are the perfections of means, vows, strength, and wisdom, respectively.

original: mtshan ma med pa la dga' ba rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la dga' ba rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the delight in the signless?

original: gang theg pa chen po la dmigs pas de bzhin nyid du ro gcig pa la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: gang theg pa chen po la dmigs pas de bzhin nyid du ro gcig pa la dga' ba'o //
translated: It is the delight in the one taste of suchness by means of the objective support of the Great Vehicle.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi shes pa lnga po ni theg @118a * //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi shes pa lnga po ni theg @118a * //
translated: The five knowledges of ordinary men are:

original: pa chen po las don gyi shes pa dang / sems can gyi shes pa dang / bdag gi shes pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa dang / 'jug pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: pa chen po las don gyi shes pa dang / sems can gyi shes pa dang / bdag gi shes pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa dang / 'jug pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of the object in the Great Vehicle, the knowledge of sentient beings, the knowledge of the self, the knowledge of discrimination, and the knowledge of engagement.

original: 'di dag kyang go rims bzhin du gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang reg bya ste yul gyi bdag nyid can gyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi dbang po'i bdag nyid can gyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang /
analyzed: 'di dag kyang go rims bzhin du gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang reg bya ste yul gyi bdag nyid can gyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi dbang po'i bdag nyid can gyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang /
translated: These are, respectively, the consciousness of the store of form, sound, smell, taste, and touch, which is the nature of the object, and the consciousness of the store of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body faculties.

original: nga dang bdag gi rnam pa can gyi nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / rim pa bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: nga dang bdag gi rnam pa can gyi nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / rim pa bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The afflicted mind that has the aspect of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù the mental consciousness, and the eye consciousness, etc., are to be applied in order.

original: de rnams kyi bdag po ni des yang dag par bsdus pa'i sgrib pa rnams dang bral pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bdag po ni des yang dag par bsdus pa'i sgrib pa rnams dang bral pa'o //
translated: The lord of those is free from the obscurations that are subsumed by that.

original: rgyu des na sems de nyid ni go rims ji lta ba bzhin du me long lta bu dang mnyam pa nyid dang / so sor rtog pa dang / bya ba grub pa'i ye shes dang / zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin dang /
analyzed: rgyu des na sems de nyid ni go rims ji lta ba bzhin du me long lta bu dang mnyam pa nyid dang / so sor rtog pa dang / bya ba grub pa'i ye shes dang / zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin dang /
translated: For that reason, the mind itself is the nature of the mirror-like wisdom, the wisdom of equality, the wisdom of individual discernment, the wisdom of accomplishing activities, and the wisdom of the exhaustion of phenomena and non-arising.

original: rnam par snang mdzad dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag tu med pa dang / don yod par grub pa dang / mi bskyod pa'i rang bzhin can yin te /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag tu med pa dang / don yod par grub pa dang / mi bskyod pa'i rang bzhin can yin te /
translated: It is the nature of Vairocana, Ratnasambhava, AmitƒÅbha, Amoghasiddhi, and Ak·π£obhya.

original: me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes ni don la sogs pa'i shes pa dag pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes ni don la sogs pa'i shes pa dag pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mirror-like pristine awareness and so forth are the characteristics of the pure consciousness of the meaning and so forth, and they are the nature of Vairochana and so forth.

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i ngo bo nyid du rab tu gsal bar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i ngo bo nyid du rab tu gsal bar snang ba yin no //
translated: The pristine awareness of exhaustion and non-arising are the nature of the lord of the mandala, and they appear clearly.

original: 'dir yang nga'i skye ba zad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa bya ba byas pa nyid kyi ye shes ni zad pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: 'dir yang nga'i skye ba zad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa bya ba byas pa nyid kyi ye shes ni zad pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Here, the pristine awareness of exhaustion is the knowledge of the completion of action, such as My births are exhausted.

original: ngas 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa bya ba gzhan med pa'i shes pa ni mi skye ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: ngas 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa bya ba gzhan med pa'i shes pa ni mi skye ba shes pa'o //
translated: The pristine awareness of non-arising is the knowledge that there is no other action, such as I will not know another existence beyond this.

original: yang lha'i de kho na nyid gzhan dag kyang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang lha'i de kho na nyid gzhan dag kyang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Again, in order to teach the other realities of the deities,

original: gzugs sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzugs sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said form and so forth.

original: sems nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa rnam par dag cing de las nges par grol ba nyid kyis rab tu bsgoms shing de'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni @118b lha rnams kyi de kho na nyid yinüîΩgyi / yongs su brtags pa'i phung po la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: sems nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa rnam par dag cing de las nges par grol ba nyid kyis rab tu bsgoms shing de'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni @118b lha rnams kyi de kho na nyid yin gyi / yongs su brtags pa'i phung po la sogs pa'am /
translated: The reality of the gods is that very form aggregate, etc., which is purified of the error of form, etc., and is definitely liberated from that.üîΩThe reality of the gods is not the imagined aggregates, etc.,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa ni lha'i de kho na nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa ni lha'i de kho na nyid ma yin no //
translated: or the contaminated, etc.

original: rnam par dag pa de yang sems las tha mi dad pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa de yang sems las tha mi dad pa yin la /
translated: And that purification is not different from mind.

original: de bas na sems de nyid ni phung po la sogs pa lha'i bdag nyid can yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sems de nyid ni phung po la sogs pa lha'i bdag nyid can yin no //
translated: Therefore, that very mind is the nature of the gods, the aggregates, etc.

original: de la sangs rgyas rnams kyi de kho na nyid ni phung po lnga ste /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas rnams kyi de kho na nyid ni phung po lnga ste /
translated: Therein, the reality of the Buddhas is the five aggregates:

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi de kho na nyid ni skye mched bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi de kho na nyid ni skye mched bcu gnyis te /
translated: The reality of the bodhisattvas is the twelve sense-fields.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams so //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams so //
translated: They are the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind, and form, sound, odor, taste, touch, and entity.

original: spyan dang / m'a ma k'i dang / gos dkar mo dang / sgrol ma dang / rdo rje 'chang ba'i de kho na nyid ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha'o //
analyzed: spyan dang / m'a ma k'i dang / gos dkar mo dang / sgrol ma dang / rdo rje 'chang ba'i de kho na nyid ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha'o //
translated: The reality of Locana, Mamaki, Pandara, and Tara, and of Vajradhara, is earth, water, fire, air, and space.

original: yang lha'i de kho na nyid gzhan dag bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yang lha'i de kho na nyid gzhan dag bstan pa ni /
translated: Again, other realities of the deities are taught, beginning with

original: ser sna zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: ser sna zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: avarice, etc.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa ni ji skad du bshad pa'i phyi rol tu phyin pa bcu'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa ni ji skad du bshad pa'i phyi rol tu phyin pa bcu'o //
translated: The perfections are the ten perfections as they have been explained.

original: sa ni bcu gcig go //
analyzed: sa ni bcu gcig go //
translated: The stages are the eleven stages.

original: shin tu gnas pa ni de rnams la sems de'i bdag nyid kyis rab tu brtan par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu gnas pa ni de rnams la sems de'i bdag nyid kyis rab tu brtan par gnas pa'o //
translated: Very firm means that the mind is very firm by its very nature in those.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ser sna la sogs gnas gyur pas //
analyzed: ser sna la sogs gnas gyur pas //
translated: Because of the transformation of avarice, etc.

original: zhes bya smos pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya smos pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: gnas gyur pa de yang sems las logs shig na med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa rnams ni lha rnams kyi de kho na nyid du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas gyur pa de yang sems las logs shig na med pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa rnams ni lha rnams kyi de kho na nyid du gyur pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, that transformation is the reality of the goddesses, the stages and perfections that do not exist apart from the mind.

original: de la lha mo bcu'i de kho na nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'o //üîΩrab tu dga' ba dang dri ma med pa ste /
analyzed: de la lha mo bcu'i de kho na nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'o // rab tu dga' ba dang dri ma med pa ste /
translated: Therein, the reality of the ten goddesses is the ten perfections.

original: sa gnyis ni gshin rje gshed kyi'o //
analyzed: sa gnyis ni gshin rje gshed kyi'o //
translated: The two stages of Very Joyful and Stainless are that of Yamantaka.

original: de nas sa gsum ni sgo srung lhag ma gsum gyi'o //
analyzed: de nas sa gsum ni sgo srung lhag ma gsum gyi'o //
translated: Then, the three stages are that of the remaining three door-guardians.

original: de nas sa lnga ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i'o //
analyzed: de nas sa lnga ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i'o //
translated: Then, the five stages are that of the five transcendent ones.

original: kun du 'od ni dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i'o //
analyzed: kun du 'od ni dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i'o //
translated: The stage of Universal Radiance is that of the lord of the mandala.

original: sa rnams kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: sa rnams kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are the stages?

original: rab tu dga' ba dang / dri ma med pa dang / 'od byed pa dang / 'od 'phro ba dang / sbyang dka' ba dang / mngon du gyur pa dang / ring du song ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang / legs pa'i blo gros dang /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba dang / dri ma med pa dang / 'od byed pa dang / 'od 'phro ba dang / sbyang dka' ba dang / mngon du gyur pa dang / ring du song ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang / legs pa'i blo gros dang /
translated: They are the stages of Very Joyful, Stainless, Radiant, Brilliance, Hard to Conquer, Manifest, Gone Far, Immovable, Excellent Wisdom,

original: chos kyi sprin dang / kun du 'od do //
analyzed: chos kyi sprin dang / kun du 'od do //
translated: Cloud of Dharma and Universal Illumination.

original: de la kun du 'gro ba'i chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs pas rab tu dga' bar gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pas gnas @119a * //
analyzed: de la kun du 'gro ba'i chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs pas rab tu dga' bar gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pas gnas @119a * //
translated: The bodhisattva who is in the stage of the Joyful, who is pure in his superior intention, who has realized the universal realm of the Dharma, who is joyful,

original: pa ni rab tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: pa ni rab tu dga' ba'o //
translated: is the Joyful.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyus rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i tshul khrims dang / yang dag par ldan par gnas pa ni dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyus rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i tshul khrims dang / yang dag par ldan par gnas pa ni dri ma med pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is in the stage of the Immaculate, who is pure in his superior intention, who is endowed with the morality of purity by nature,

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa'i dri ma dang bral bas tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i rgyus 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'i snang bas gnas pa ni 'od byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa'i dri ma dang bral bas tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i rgyus 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa'i snang bas gnas pa ni 'od byed pa'o //
translated: who is endowed with the light of the meditative concentrations and meditative attainments of the mundane sphere, who is free from the stain of immorality, who is endowed with the cause of pure morality,üîΩis the Immaculate.

original: ting nge 'dzin de nyid la brten te byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun rnam par dpyod pa'i 'od dang yang dag par ldan pas gnas pa ni 'od 'phro ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de nyid la brten te byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun rnam par dpyod pa'i 'od dang yang dag par ldan pas gnas pa ni 'od 'phro ba'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is in the stage of the Luminous, who is endowed with the light of the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment, who is endowed with the light of the investigation of those very meditative concentrations and meditative attainments,üîΩis the Luminous.

original: rnam par 'byed pa de nyid la brten nas sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa rnam par 'byed pa ni sbyang dka' ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa de nyid la brten nas sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa rnam par 'byed pa ni sbyang dka' ba ste /
translated: The difficulty of training is the analysis of the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path, based on that very analysis.

original: dka' bas rgyal zhing bslab pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde la brten nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis rnam par 'byed pas gnas pa ni mngon du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: dka' bas rgyal zhing bslab pa'i phyir ro // de la brten nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis rnam par 'byed pas gnas pa ni mngon du gyur pa ste /
translated: The stage of difficulty in training is the stage of the difficulty of training, because one trains in the difficult training of the differentiation of the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path, based on that differentiation.

original: thogs pa med pa'i ye shes mngon du gyur pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas gnas pa der mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i ye shes mngon du gyur pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas gnas pa der mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The stage of presence is the stage of presence, because the perfection of wisdom is present there, the wisdom of the unobstructed knowledge of the twelve factors of dependent origination, based on that.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa rab tu rnam par 'byed pa la dbang thob pas 'bad pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pas mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa ni ring du song ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa rab tu rnam par 'byed pa la dbang thob pas 'bad pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pas mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa ni ring du song ba ste /
translated: The stage of far-reaching is the stage of far-reaching, because one engages in uninterrupted effort through attaining mastery in the differentiation of the factors of enlightenment and so on.

original: sbyor pa'i spyod pa'i mthar thug par song ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor pa'i spyod pa'i mthar thug par song ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is far-reaching because it reaches the end of the practice of application.

original: de la brten nas rang gi ngang gis rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pas mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa ni mi g-yo ba ste /
analyzed: de la brten nas rang gi ngang gis rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pas mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa ni mi g-yo ba ste /
translated: And on the basis of that, one abides in the signless, which is unshakable, because it engages in the signless naturally and uninterruptedly.

original: der sems kyi mtshan ma med pa la g-yo ba med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der sems kyi mtshan ma med pa la g-yo ba med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the sign of mind is unshakable in the signless.

original: g-yo ba med pa'i shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin la brten nas chos dang don dang nges pa'i tshig dang spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa rnam par dag pa la gnas pa ni legs pa'i blo gros te /
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa'i shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin la brten nas chos dang don dang nges pa'i tshig dang spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa rnam par dag pa la gnas pa ni legs pa'i blo gros te /
translated: And on the basis of unshakable wisdom and samadhi, one abides in the purity of the correct and discerning awareness of Dharma, meaning, definitions, and confidence, which is excellent wisdom.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa'i blo der legs par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa'i blo der legs par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that wisdom of correct and discerning awareness is excellent there.

original: char 'bebs pa ni sprin te /
analyzed: char 'bebs pa ni sprin te /
translated: It is like a cloud, because it rains.

original: dbang skur ba'am char 'bebs pa'o//
analyzed: dbang skur ba'am char 'bebs pa'o//
translated: It is like a cloud, because it rains or bestows empowerment.

original: de yang gang la gnas na byang chub chen por chos kyi dbang bskur ba thob pa dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi char shin tu rgya chen po bdag nyid kyang len cing /
analyzed: de yang gang la gnas na byang chub chen por chos kyi dbang bskur ba thob pa dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi char shin tu rgya chen po bdag nyid kyang len cing /
translated: And when one abides in that, one receives the empowerment of the Dharma of great enlightenment and one also receives the vast Dharma rain of the buddhas.

original: sems can rnams la yang ster bar byed pa ni chos kyi sprin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams la yang ster bar byed pa ni chos kyi sprin no //
translated: And they give it to sentient beings. This is the Cloud of Dharma.

original: gang la gnas na sgrib pa'i bag chags thams cad yang dag par @119b bcom pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rnam par dag pa'i mthar thug pa ni kun du 'od do //
analyzed: gang la gnas na sgrib pa'i bag chags thams cad yang dag par @119b bcom pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rnam par dag pa'i mthar thug pa ni kun du 'od do //
translated: The Universal Light is the stage where one completely conquers all the instincts for the veils, and reaches the ultimate purity of all the Buddha natures.

original: ser sna la sogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ser sna la sogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What are stinginess, etc.?

original: ser sna ni sbyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i sems las byung ba'i chos so //
analyzed: ser sna ni sbyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i sems las byung ba'i chos so //
translated: Stinginess is a mental event which is the opposite of generosity.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa ni tshul khrims gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so ;
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa ni tshul khrims gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs so ;
translated: Immorality is the opposite of morality.

original: / mi bzod pa ni bzod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: / mi bzod pa ni bzod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /
translated: Non-forbearance is the opposite of forbearance.

original: khro ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / 'jigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: khro ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / 'jigs pa nyid do //
translated: It is anger, suffering, and fear.

original: de bzhin du brtson 'grus la sogs pa'i mi mthun par gyur pa ni le lo la sogs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du brtson 'grus la sogs pa'i mi mthun par gyur pa ni le lo la sogs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand that laziness, etc., are the opposites of vigor, etc.

original: gzhan yang lha'i de kho na nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang lha'i de kho na nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to teach the reality of the gods,

original: rang gi mi mthun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang gi mi mthun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The ten powers of the Tathagata are the reality of the ten goddesses.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu po don bcu po la nus pa thogs pa med pa mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid can ni lha mo bcu po'i de kho na nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu po don bcu po la nus pa thogs pa med pa mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid can ni lha mo bcu po'i de kho na nyid yin no //
translated: The ten powers of the Tathagata, which have the characteristic of unobstructed knowledge of the ten topics, are the reality of the ten goddesses.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi'i bdag nyid ni go rims bzhin du ye shes dang / spangs pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs ston pa dang / gnyen po'i phyogs ston pa la bsnyengs pa mi mnga' bar so sor mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi'i bdag nyid ni go rims bzhin du ye shes dang / spangs pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs ston pa dang / gnyen po'i phyogs ston pa la bsnyengs pa mi mnga' bar so sor mkhyen pa'o //
translated: The four fearlessnesses are the knowledge of the absence of fear with regard to teaching knowledge, abandonment, the adverse factors, and the counteragents, respectively.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi po de dag ni sgo srung rnams kyi de kho na nyid yin no //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi po de dag ni sgo srung rnams kyi de kho na nyid yin no //
translated: These four fearlessnesses are the reality of the gatekeepers.

original: yongs su dag pa bzhi po dang / bag chags yang dag par bcom pa dang / rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog mkhyen pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa bzhi po dang / bag chags yang dag par bcom pa dang / rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog mkhyen pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: The four purities, the complete destruction of the traces, and the knowledge of all aspects are the reality of the lord of the mandala.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos lhag ma thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos lhag ma thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ste /
translated: All the remaining Buddha qualities are those of all the Tathagatas.

original: yan lag 'ga' yis khyad par du gyur pa rnams kyi de kho na nyid yin no //
analyzed: yan lag 'ga' yis khyad par du gyur pa rnams kyi de kho na nyid yin no //
translated: It is the reality of those who are distinguished by some limbs.

original: de la stobs la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs las dben pa'i sems nyid ni stobs la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la stobs la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs las dben pa'i sems nyid ni stobs la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Therein, the mind itself, which is isolated from the resistances of the powers, etc., is the powers, etc.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: stobs sogs tshang zhing dri ma med //
analyzed: stobs sogs tshang zhing dri ma med //
translated: it is endowed with the powers, etc., and is stainless.

original: ces bya ste /
analyzed: ces bya ste /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: stobs la sogs pa lus pa med pa dri ma med pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: stobs la sogs pa lus pa med pa dri ma med pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the nature of the stainless qualities, which are the complete powers, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir lha rnams kyi bdag nyid can yang yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir lha rnams kyi bdag nyid can yang yin no //
translated: For that very reason, it is also the nature of the gods.

original: gzhan yang thun mong du gyur pa'i lha rnams kyi de kho na nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang thun mong du gyur pa'i lha rnams kyi de kho na nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to teach the reality of the common gods, he says,

original: rnam par mi rtog ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: non-conceptual, etc.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ni lha thams cad ni shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ni lha thams cad ni shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can yin no //
translated: Because all the gods have the nature of wisdom and means.

original: de la shes rab kyi de kho na nyid ni zab pa ste /
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi de kho na nyid ni zab pa ste /
translated: Therein, the reality of wisdom is profundity,

original: de yang rnam par mi rtog pa nyid @120a * //üîΩyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang rnam par mi rtog pa nyid @120a * //üîΩyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and that is non-conceptuality.

original: thabs kyi de kho na nyid ni rgya che ba ste /
analyzed: thabs kyi de kho na nyid ni rgya che ba ste /
translated: The reality of the means is the extensive one.

original: de yang rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is the mastery of the perfection of one's own and others' goals.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa nyid dang dbang byed pa de yang sems nyid kyi rnam par dag pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa nyid dang dbang byed pa de yang sems nyid kyi rnam par dag pa yin no //
translated: That non-conceptuality and mastery are the purity of the mind itself.

original: de bas na de'i bdag nyid can gyi sems ni lha thams cad kyi bdag nyid can yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na de'i bdag nyid can gyi sems ni lha thams cad kyi bdag nyid can yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the mind that has that nature is the nature of all the deities.

original: gal te ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis sems kyi chos rnams nyid lha rnams yin na sems kyi chos tha dad pa la sogs pa de yang ci sems las tha dad pa yin nam tha mi dad pa yin /
analyzed: gal te ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis sems kyi chos rnams nyid lha rnams yin na sems kyi chos tha dad pa la sogs pa de yang ci sems las tha dad pa yin nam tha mi dad pa yin /
translated: If the deities are the dharmas of the mind in the manner that has been explained, then are those different dharmas of the mind, such as the different ones, different from the mind or not different?

original: tha mi dad pa yin na de'i bdag nyid can gyis sems gcig yin nam du ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa yin na de'i bdag nyid can gyis sems gcig yin nam du ma yin zhe na /
translated: If they are not different, then is the mind that has their nature one or many?üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / so so rang rig chos yin phyir //üîΩdbye yod dbye med sogs mi gnas //
analyzed: de'i phyir / so so rang rig chos yin phyir // dbye yod dbye med sogs mi gnas //
translated: Because they are dharmas of individual self-awareness,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: they do not abide in difference, non-difference, and so on.

original: rang rig pa'i dad pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i dad pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is called that because it is the nature of the Dharma of faith, etc. which is self-cognizant.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ni de nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ni de nyid do //
translated: Its essence is just that.

original: de yang rig cing tshor bzhin pa'i chos thams cad ni sems las logs shig na med de /
analyzed: de yang rig cing tshor bzhin pa'i chos thams cad ni sems las logs shig na med de /
translated: Moreover, all the Dharmas of the cognized and the feeling are not apart from the mind,

original: sems dang yang dag par rig pa gnyis ni nam mkha' gsal ba'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang yang dag par rig pa gnyis ni nam mkha' gsal ba'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind and the true cognition have the characteristic of the illumination of space.

original: dbye ba med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dbye ba med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it without distinction,

original: sems gcig las de rnams tha mi dad na gcig bu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: sems gcig las de rnams tha mi dad na gcig bu nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: because if those were not different from the one mind, it would follow that there would be only one.

original: / de lta na ni sems nyid gcig pa dang / du mar 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: / de lta na ni sems nyid gcig pa dang / du mar 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If that were so, the mind would be both one and many.

original: tha mi dad par yang dag par rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad par yang dag par rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because of the true cognition of the non-difference.

original: du ma yin na ni skyes bu du ma'i sems dang 'dra bar so sor rig par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: du ma yin na ni skyes bu du ma'i sems dang 'dra bar so sor rig par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If it were many, it would be cognized individually, like the minds of many people.

original: de lta na ni sems gcig pu 'di nyid rnam par du ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na ni sems gcig pu 'di nyid rnam par du ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If that were so, this one mind would be many. That is not so,üîΩbecause of the non-difference of the essence of the mind.

original: sems gcig las tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa rnams du ma nyid yin par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems gcig las tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa rnams du ma nyid yin par 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is contradictory for the aspects, which are not different from a single mind, to be multiple.

original: gcig pa dang du mar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gcig pa dang du mar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is both one and many,

original: tha dad pa'i phyogs ni sngar sun phyung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i phyogs ni sngar sun phyung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the position of difference has already been refuted.

original: de bas na gang gi phyir 'di dag thams cad ni so so rang gis rig pa yin zhing sems 'di nyid kyis yang dag par rig pa yin no //üîΩde'i phyir sems kho na las dbye ba yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: de bas na gang gi phyir 'di dag thams cad ni so so rang gis rig pa yin zhing sems 'di nyid kyis yang dag par rig pa yin no // de'i phyir sems kho na las dbye ba yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: Therefore, since all of these are individually self-aware, and since they are correctly known by this very mind,üîΩthe mind itself is neither differentiated nor undifferentiated.

original: dbye ba med pa yang ma yin par rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: dbye ba med pa yang ma yin par rnam par gnas so //
translated: It is established that the mind itself is neither differentiated nor undifferentiated.

original: chos 'di dag dang ldan pa nyid ni gcig nyid du yang ma yin la du ma nyid du yang gnas pa ma yin no //üîΩdes na 'di ltar dbye ba yod pa dang dbye ba med @120b pa'i bdag nyid can nam /
analyzed: chos 'di dag dang ldan pa nyid ni gcig nyid du yang ma yin la du ma nyid du yang gnas pa ma yin no // des na 'di ltar dbye ba yod pa dang dbye ba med @120b pa'i bdag nyid can nam /
translated: Those who possess these qualities are neither one nor many.üîΩThus, since it is neither a single entity nor a manifold entity,

original: gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid du 'gyur ba'i gnyis med pas sems de ni gnyis su med pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid dang du ma nyid du 'gyur ba'i gnyis med pas sems de ni gnyis su med pa nyid yin la /
translated: the mind is nondual.

original: gnyis su med pa'i phyir spros pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i phyir spros pa med pa yin no //
translated: Because it is nondual, it is free of elaboration.üîΩIf the mind is free of elaboration in that way, why is it elaborated?

original: gal te de ltar sems spros pa med pa la ci'i phyir spros par byas she na de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar sems spros pa med pa la ci'i phyir spros par byas she na de'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thus, etc.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni lha rnams kyi sgo dang / de kho na nyid kyi sgo nas spros par byas pa'i sems kyi 'bras bur gyur pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams su 'gyur zhing snang ba thob par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni lha rnams kyi sgo dang / de kho na nyid kyi sgo nas spros par byas pa'i sems kyi 'bras bur gyur pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams su 'gyur zhing snang ba thob par 'gyur ba yin gyi /

analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis gang du dbugs dbyung ba de ni dam tshig gsum mo //

analyzed: mchog ces bya ba ni yon tan gyis so //

analyzed: legs par gnas pa ni bde 'gro'i bde bar nges pas so //

analyzed: mi tshugs pa dang mi gsod pa ni bdud rnams kyis te /

analyzed: srid pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: chos kyi sku thob pas mtha' med pa'i srid pa nyid yongs su dag par gyur pa ni sdug bsngal las ldog pa yin gyi /

analyzed: mchog ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //

original: gyur pa ni song ba ste /
analyzed: gyur pa ni song ba ste /

analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku thob pas tha ma med pa'i srid pa 'grub pa yin gyi so so'i skye bo ltar tha mar gyur pa ni ma yin no //

analyzed: dam tshig @124b ni 'da' bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni 'og nas bshad pa'o //

analyzed: bskyed pa tsam ni byang chub tu smon pa las sa ma 'jug pa las te snying ga'i zla bar rdo rje'i rnam pa'o //

analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid du zhes bya ba ni byang chub tu nges pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa bshad pa'am /

analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos bshad pa spong zhing 'gog tu 'jug pa 'di ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba gnyis po zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor gyi sems yongs su bor nas te /

analyzed: ci nas kyang rnal 'byor dang mi mthun par gyur pas gzir bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: gzhan yang bdag nyid 'di ni /
translated: Moreover, this very self

analyzed: yongs su tshol ba'i sdug bsngal dang / nyes par spyod pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: yang ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: brtan pa ni rgyal srid de nyid dang bcas pas rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa'i rgyu des na bla ma dang sangs rgyas la sogs pa la yid ni /
translated: It is stable because it is permanent, along with that very kingdom.üîΩFor that reason, one's mind should be

analyzed: so sor blang bar bya'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
