translated: because it would follow that existence would be reversed by cultivating the base of infinite space.

original: de ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang 'di ni gzhan du bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni bden mod kyi 'on kyang 'di ni gzhan du bshad pa yin te /
translated: That is true, but this is explained elsewhere.

original: gang gi phyir 'dir tha mal pa'i kun du rtog pa zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can gyi yid kyis brjod pa la bya bar bshad na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir tha mal pa'i kun du rtog pa zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi dang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can gyi yid kyis brjod pa la bya bar bshad na /
translated: Here, if what is called ordinary conception is explained as the mental expression that has the aspect of self, mine, apprehended object, and apprehending subject,

original: srid pa'i bdag nyid can gyi sdug bsngal zhes bya bar nye bar gdags pas srid pa'i bdag nyid can gyi sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i gtso bo yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: srid pa'i bdag nyid can gyi sdug bsngal zhes bya bar nye bar gdags pas srid pa'i bdag nyid can gyi sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'i gtso bo yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: then it is the principal cause of the suffering that is the nature of existence, since it is designated as the suffering that is the nature of existence.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni tha mal pa'i rtog pa'i bdag nyid can gyi sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni tha mal pa'i rtog pa'i bdag nyid can gyi sdug bsngal gyi rgyu'o //
translated: This is the cause of suffering, which has the nature of ordinary conceptualization.

original: rtog pa de snang bar mi 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa can gyi sems ni mi bden pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad bsal ba la 'jug pa yin @127b pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa de snang bar mi 'gyur la zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa can gyi sems ni mi bden pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad bsal ba la 'jug pa yin @127b pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That conceptualization does not appear means that the mind, which has the form of a ma·πá·∏çala, is engaged in removing all unreal conceptualizations.

original: de yang lhan cig mi snang ba tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang lhan cig mi snang ba tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: And that is not merely the non-appearance of both together.

original: de bas na 'di gnyis ni lan cig mi mthun par grub na rtag tu mi mthun par grub pa yin pas 'di yang rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di gnyis ni lan cig mi mthun par grub na rtag tu mi mthun par grub pa yin pas 'di yang rigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when these two are established as incompatible once, they are always established as incompatible. This is also reasonable.

original: rtag tu de dang mi mthun pa la dmigs pa'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir goms pa mngon du gyur ba ni shin du ldog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu de dang mi mthun pa la dmigs pa'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir goms pa mngon du gyur ba ni shin du ldog pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it always has the aspect of observing what is incompatible with that, when the cultivation becomes manifest, it is completely reversed.üîΩAnd that is so,

original: de yang / 'tshe ba med dang yang dag don //
analyzed: de yang / 'tshe ba med dang yang dag don //
translated: because of non-violence, the true meaning,

original: ngo bo nyid la phyir ldog gis //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la phyir ldog gis //
translated: and turning away from the nature.

original: 'bad du zin kyang gnod med de //
analyzed: 'bad du zin kyang gnod med de //
translated: Even if one tries, there is no harm.

original: blo ni de phyogs 'dzin phyir ro //
analyzed: blo ni de phyogs 'dzin phyir ro //
translated: because the mind is occupied with that.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pas so //
translated: This is the verse.

original: gnyen po dang mi mthun pa ldog pa dang 'jug pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyen po dang mi mthun pa ldog pa dang 'jug pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The antidote and the opposite do not exist, nor does engagement.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa ni bdag med pa'i rnam par 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa ni bdag med pa'i rnam par 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: The base of infinite space, etc., do not engage the aspect of selflessness,

original: de bdag tu lta ba las mi ldog pa'i phyir de'i rgyu can sdug bsngal yang ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bdag tu lta ba las mi ldog pa'i phyir de'i rgyu can sdug bsngal yang ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: because they do not turn away from the view of self, and because of that, they do not turn away from the truth of suffering.

original: de yang 'di ni skye ba nas skye bar brgyud pa'i dga' ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de yang 'di ni skye ba nas skye bar brgyud pa'i dga' ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: Moreover, this is the truth of suffering, which is the pleasure of the continuum of births and deaths, etc.

original: de'i rgyur gyur pa bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyur gyur pa bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of origination is the view of self, etc., which are the causes of that.

original: de'i gnyen por gyur pa dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por gyur pa dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of the path is the wheel of the mandala, which is the antidote to that.

original: sdug bsngal 'byung ba shin tu med par bya ba'i phyir sems kyi rgyun gyi mtshan nyid can gnas yongs su gyur pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa ste 'di ni 'dir don dam pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'byung ba shin tu med par bya ba'i phyir sems kyi rgyun gyi mtshan nyid can gnas yongs su gyur pa ni 'gog pa'i bden pa ste 'di ni 'dir don dam pa'o //
translated: The transformation of the basis, which has the nature of the continuum of mind, is the truth of cessation, because it is the means of completely eliminating the occurrence of suffering. This is the ultimate here.

original: lam 'di ni thar pa 'ba' zhig tsam gyi ma yin gyi gzhan du na sangs rgyas kyi bdag nyid che ba yang yin te /
analyzed: lam 'di ni thar pa 'ba' zhig tsam gyi ma yin gyi gzhan du na sangs rgyas kyi bdag nyid che ba yang yin te /
translated: This path is not only for liberation alone, but also for the greatness of the nature of a Buddha,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang de las gzhan pa'i dngos po thams cad kyang chos bdag med pa'i mnyam pa nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i tshul du nges par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang de las gzhan pa'i dngos po thams cad kyang chos bdag med pa'i mnyam pa nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i tshul du nges par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all Buddha dharmas and all other things are ascertained as the wheel of the mandala of the equality of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: 'dis byang chub par ni 'gyur na de yang bskal pa du zhig gis 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'dis byang chub par ni 'gyur na de yang bskal pa du zhig gis 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one becomes enlightened by this, then how many eons does it take?

original: brjod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ste /
translated: It is to be stated.

original: de'i phyir chos kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said ‚Äúall phenomena‚Äù and so on.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin can gyi 'khor lo gang yin pa dang / 'gro ba ste sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten de gnyis kyi yongs su dag pa ni rnam pa thams cad du yang dag pa de la 'jug pa mngon sum du gyur cing sgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa thob pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩde bas na mngon sum gyi rgyu nyid las skad @128a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin can gyi 'khor lo gang yin pa dang / 'gro ba ste sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten de gnyis kyi yongs su dag pa ni rnam pa thams cad du yang dag pa de la 'jug pa mngon sum du gyur cing sgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa thob pa gang yin pa'o // de bas na mngon sum gyi rgyu nyid las skad @128a * //
translated: The wheel which is the nature of all the qualities of a Buddha, and the purity of the two, the world of beings and the world of the environment, is the direct realization of that reality in all its aspects, and the attainment of the perfection of meditation.

original: cig ma nyid kyis byang chub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: cig ma nyid kyis byang chub par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, because of being the cause of direct realization, one becomes enlightened in a single moment.

original: mngon sum gyi rgyu'i 'bras bu ni gzhan gyis bar ma bcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi rgyu'i 'bras bu ni gzhan gyis bar ma bcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The result of the cause of direct realization is not interrupted by anything else.

original: 'on te mngon sum du byed pa'i 'jug pa de bskal pa dus 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dris pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum du byed pa'i 'jug pa de bskal pa dus 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dris pa'i don to //
translated: Or, the meaning of the question is: ‚ÄúIs that direct realization, which is the transformation of the basis, in a single moment, or in a succession of moments?‚Äù

original: de yang ji srid ni sgom pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur ba'i dus de srid kyis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang ji srid ni sgom pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur ba'i dus de srid kyis 'gyur ro //
translated: And that is so for as long as the perfection of meditation lasts.

original: de bas na mngon du byed pa 'di la bskal pa la ltos pa ni 'bras bu med do //
analyzed: de bas na mngon du byed pa 'di la bskal pa la ltos pa ni 'bras bu med do //
translated: Therefore, in this direct realization, there is no result that depends on eons.

original: 'bras bu med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that there is no result.

original: de yang gang gi phyir rgyu ni 'bras bu dang rjes su mthun par 'gyur ba yin pas /
analyzed: de yang gang gi phyir rgyu ni 'bras bu dang rjes su mthun par 'gyur ba yin pas /
translated: Moreover, because the cause is concordant with the result,

original: de'i phyir bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis byang chub thob par pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul las gsungs pa de ni legs par bshad pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis byang chub thob par pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul las gsungs pa de ni legs par bshad pa yin la /
translated: it is well explained that enlightenment is attained in three incalculable aeons in the Perfection Vehicle.

original: gang yang rgyud 'di las skad cig thang cig yud tsam nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi byang chub rdzogs par 'gyur bar gsungs pa de ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: gang yang rgyud 'di las skad cig thang cig yud tsam nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyi byang chub rdzogs par 'gyur bar gsungs pa de ni mi rigs so //
translated: But it is illogical that buddha enlightenment is perfected in just an instant, a moment, a flash, as this tantra teaches.

original: yang na ni khyad par zhig brjod dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: yang na ni khyad par zhig brjod dgos so zhe na /
translated: Or else, some distinction must be stated.

original: de'i phyir khyad par bshad pa ni /üîΩrim gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par bshad pa ni / rim gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, to explain the distinction, he says:üîΩThe stages of generosity and so onüîΩare profound and vast.üîΩThe stages of generosity and so on are profound and vast.

original: rim gyis sbyin pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni sbyin par bya ba dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa mi dmigs su zin kyang zab pa nyid du 'gyur gyi rgya che bar ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rim gyis sbyin pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni sbyin par bya ba dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa mi dmigs su zin kyang zab pa nyid du 'gyur gyi rgya che bar ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: The stages of generosity and so on that are gradual are profound, even though the object of generosity, ethics, and so on are not observed, but they are not vast.

original: tha mal pa nyid ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mal pa nyid ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the ordinary is not abandoned.

original: de bas na der de tsam gyi dus nyid kyi rgya che ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la bskal ba grangs med pa gsum gyis zhes dus kyi tshad gzung ba ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na der de tsam gyi dus nyid kyi rgya che ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la bskal ba grangs med pa gsum gyis zhes dus kyi tshad gzung ba ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to posit a measure of time in the perfection vehicle, saying that the three incalculable eons are required for the perfection of the great in that system, since the great is perfected in just that much time.

original: de la ji ltar na tha mal pa spong bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na tha mal pa spong bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is the ordinary abandoned there?

original: de'i phyir rang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúin the self,‚Äù etc.

original: 'di tsam gyis zhes bya bas phyogs dang dus yongs su bcad pa med pa gang yin pa de ni chen po yin pas rgya che ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis zhes bya bas phyogs dang dus yongs su bcad pa med pa gang yin pa de ni chen po yin pas rgya che ba yin la /
translated: That which is not limited in terms of direction and time is great, and thus is the great.

original: gang rang gi yul dang dus kyi rnam pa nges pa'i bdag nyid can de ni chung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir tha mal pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gang rang gi yul dang dus kyi rnam pa nges pa'i bdag nyid can de ni chung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir tha mal pa zhes bshad do //
translated: That which has the nature of a limited object and time is small, and thus is the ordinary.

original: de lta bu'i sbyin pa la sogs pa ni la lar lan 'ga' zhig gis rnam pa gang yang rung bas sbyin pa la sogs pa sgrib pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sbyin pa la sogs pa ni la lar lan 'ga' zhig gis rnam pa gang yang rung bas sbyin pa la sogs pa sgrib pa yin no //
translated: Such generosity, etc. is an obscuration to generosity, etc. in some cases, in some way.

original: de ltar na rgyud 'di ji ltar na rgya che ba yin /
analyzed: de ltar na rgyud 'di ji ltar na rgya che ba yin /
translated: How is this tantra extensive?

original: gang gis skad cig gis byang chub par 'gyur zhe @128b na ;
analyzed: gang gis skad cig gis byang chub par 'gyur zhe @128b na ;
translated: By what is one enlightened in an instant?

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúthe world,‚Äù etc.

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba sems can yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rang bzhin can gyi 'khor lo gang yin pa rgyud 'dir rnal 'byor pa ni de'i bdag nyid can yin pas de na tshe 'di nyid la ji skad du bshad pa'i mngon du gyur pa 'thob
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba sems can yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rang bzhin can gyi 'khor lo gang yin pa rgyud 'dir rnal 'byor pa ni de'i bdag nyid can yin pas de na tshe 'di nyid la ji skad du bshad pa'i mngon du gyur pa 'thob
translated: Therefore, since the yogi/nƒ´ is of the nature of the wheel of the world of sentient beings, which is of the nature of perfect enlightenment, in this very life, he/she attains the manifest, as explained above.

original: pas byang chub mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba ni rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: pas byang chub mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba ni rigs pa yin no //
translated: It is reasonable that he/she will realize enlightenment.

original: de yang 'dir phyogs bcu dus gsum du gtogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' ma lus pa'i yon tan gyi 'byor pa thams cad de rnams nyid kyi bla na med cing don yod pa'i dam tshig gi bdag nyid can nyid dang / bla na med pa'i mchod pa'i bdag nyid can dang /üîΩbde ba chen po'i rang bzhin can dang / yid du 'ong ba'i rnam pa can gyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo lta bur spro ba dang bsdu ba dang ldan pas mdor bsdus te /
analyzed: de yang 'dir phyogs bcu dus gsum du gtogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' ma lus pa'i yon tan gyi 'byor pa thams cad de rnams nyid kyi bla na med cing don yod pa'i dam tshig gi bdag nyid can nyid dang / bla na med pa'i mchod pa'i bdag nyid can dang / bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin can dang / yid du 'ong ba'i rnam pa can gyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo lta bur spro ba dang bsdu ba dang ldan pas mdor bsdus te /
translated: and into the nature of unsurpassed worship,üîΩand into the nature of great bliss,

original: sems can thams cad bdag nyid la bskyed nas mnyam par bzhag pas goms par byed la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad bdag nyid la bskyed nas mnyam par bzhag pas goms par byed la /
translated: and into the form of a mandala circle endowed with emanation and gathering, and is generated in oneself as all sentient beings, and is cultivated in meditative equipoise.

original: de lta bu nyid kyang kun du spyod pa rnams dang / bzlas pa la sogs pas rjes su 'jug cing rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid kyang kun du spyod pa rnams dang / bzlas pa la sogs pas rjes su 'jug cing rtogs par byed do //
translated: And that very [condensed form] is engaged in and realized through conduct, recitation, and so forth.

original: de bas na sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa thams cad kyang mchog tu rmad du byung zhing rgya che ba yin la ;
analyzed: de bas na sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa thams cad kyang mchog tu rmad du byung zhing rgya che ba yin la ;
translated: Therefore, generosity, morality, and so forth are all supreme, marvelous, and vast.

original: de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin can du thams cad rtag tu mthong bas zab pa yang 'dir mchog tu gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin can du thams cad rtag tu mthong bas zab pa yang 'dir mchog tu gyur pa yin te /
translated: And here, since everything is always seen as having the nature of reality, the profundity is supreme.

original: dmigs pa yid du 'ong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa yid du 'ong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object of observation is pleasing.

original: dam tshig gi mthu dang sems kyi dmigs pa yin pas dga' ba med pa yang yin no //
analyzed: dam tshig gi mthu dang sems kyi dmigs pa yin pas dga' ba med pa yang yin no //
translated: And there is no joy, because of the power of the commitments and the object of observation of the mind.

original: de bas na tshe 'di nyid la skad cig tsam gyis 'dir byang chub rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rigs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na tshe 'di nyid la skad cig tsam gyis 'dir byang chub rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rigs pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to say that enlightenment is realized in this very life in just an instant.

original: 'dis tshigs su bcad pa ni /
analyzed: 'dis tshigs su bcad pa ni /
translated: This is the verse.

original: yon tan tshogs kun rang bzhin gyis legs bslabs //
analyzed: yon tan tshogs kun rang bzhin gyis legs bslabs //
translated: All the collections of good qualities are naturally well trained,

original: rgyal ba rnams kyi dam tshig grogs 'gyur cing //
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyi dam tshig grogs 'gyur cing //
translated: and the commitments of the victors become friends.

original: de bzhin kun spyod gzhan yang bzlas la sogs ;
analyzed: de bzhin kun spyod gzhan yang bzlas la sogs ;
translated: Likewise, all other practices, such as recitation and so forth,

original: / thams cad sems byung de phyir myur byang chub //
analyzed: / thams cad sems byung de phyir myur byang chub //
translated: are mental states. Therefore, enlightenment is swift.

original: ces 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: ces 'byung ba yin no //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa la 'di lta bu'i rgya che ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la yang yod de /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa la 'di lta bu'i rgya che ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la yang yod de /
translated: Some may think that such vastness is also present in the perfection system of generosity and so forth,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su zin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'ga' zhig rtog na /üîΩde'i phyir sbyin bya @129a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su zin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'ga' zhig rtog na / de'i phyir sbyin bya @129a * //
translated: because it is fully embraced by the perfection of wisdom.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThe object to be given and so forth are not observed,‚Äù and so on.

original: sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa mi dmigs su zin kyang sbyin pa la sogs pa de dag tha mal pa'i bdag nyid can yin te /
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa mi dmigs su zin kyang sbyin pa la sogs pa de dag tha mal pa'i bdag nyid can yin te /
translated: Even though the object to be given and so forth are not observed, those such as generosity are of the nature of the ordinary,üîΩbecause they are limited by the aspect of place and time.

original: yul dang dus kyi rnam pa yongs su gcod pa'i phyir bdag med pas tshad can 'joms par mi byed kyi /
analyzed: yul dang dus kyi rnam pa yongs su gcod pa'i phyir bdag med pas tshad can 'joms par mi byed kyi /
translated: The self does not destroy the limited,

original: 'khor lo'i mchog ste dam pa la ni de yod pa ma yin no zhes sngar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i mchog ste dam pa la ni de yod pa ma yin no zhes sngar bshad pa yin no //
translated: but that does not exist in the supreme, the sublime wheel, as was previously explained.

original: de bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye bar sdud par byed pa'i tshigs su bcad pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye bar sdud par byed pa'i tshigs su bcad pa yin te /
translated: The verse ‚ÄúTherefore, all conceptualization‚Äù and so on is a concluding verse.

original: kun du rtog pa ni tha mal pa'i bag chags thams cad do //
analyzed: kun du rtog pa ni tha mal pa'i bag chags thams cad do //
translated: Conceptualization is all the habitual tendencies of the ordinary.

original: kun nas 'phro ba ni 'gro ba thams cad kyi don rnam pa thams cad du byed pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sprul pas 'gro ba thams cad khyab pa'i 'od gang la mnga' ba de ni /
analyzed: kun nas 'phro ba ni 'gro ba thams cad kyi don rnam pa thams cad du byed pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sprul pas 'gro ba thams cad khyab pa'i 'od gang la mnga' ba de ni /
